title: Machine Learning-Based Design Strategies for Heat Transfer Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic thermodynamics and fluid mechanics concepts, along with fundamental smartphone and tablet operation skills
context.additional_context: A course focused on developing practical solutions for improving thermal management efficiency in industrial settings, with modular 10-minute learning segments via mobile devices.

learning_goals: Learners can plan optimal experimental conditions for heat transfer using the Box-Behnken design principle
Learners can apply thermal conductivity enhancement mechanisms of nanocomposites to industrial case studies
Learners can predict heat transfer rates and derive optimal operating conditions using machine learning models
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
